intro: Critonia iltisii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in spring. It is well adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and thrives in well-drained soils. Critonia iltisii has historical significance for Māori culture and was traditionally used for weaving baskets and other crafts.
